review: This device just does not cut it.  It's more frustrating than anything because I bought this so I could more easily stream from Amazon I really wanted to like it.  I have tried a lot of things and I really wanted it to work but it doesn't.  It clearly has networking issues.  There are a ton of complaints and failed troubleshooting processes out there but from what I have seen others have not been able to get this thing to work well either.  All other devices on my network work fine but the AFS starts stuttering or dropping  connection within an hour of starting.  When prompted to go to the network settings the only thing offered is Very Strong signal and  connected with problems.  Nothing else.  Does not say what the problem is.  Does not allow you to disconnect and reconnect from the network  only forget the network and then rejoin so you have to enter the password all over again and again the result is the same.  A connection for a while and then after it becomes connected with problems.  How does one do you diagnosis of the problem when it says it connects with a strong signal but nothing else.  Never had an issue like this with Chromecast and I have heard good things about Roku stick so I guess I will eventually get one of those.  {I would get another Chromecast but I want to stream amazon prime on this tv}.  The device is flawed.  I wish it was not to late to send back because I would in a heartbeat as it is now it will just go into the box of junk for recycling.
author: M. Johnson "Mr Bad Example"

review: Does not always work with Att Uverse. I called Amazon support, they  gave me a  list of changes to my att uverse router. ATT said fine we can do that "but" it may effect your other internet devices. I think I'll wait till Amazon gets the bugs & updates before I get another fire stick.
author: BT

review: We bought this after having some problems with our Chromecast (too much trouble shooting after not using it for a day or two..). I LOVE the Firestick. It's super easy to use, and I love the password control on Prime so we can control what our kids have access to. It's super easy to access Netflix and Hulu, etc. also.
author: nhanc

review: This is a great way to get your Amazon Prime Videos on the big TV. I like that there is a remote so you do not have to have your phone or tablet out and awake the whole time you are watching. The user interface is easy to use.
author: C. Johanson

review: I'm sure the technology is fine which is the reason for 2 stars. There is a design flaw in the stick itself; it is too long. I have a 2 year old 42" Samsung flatscreen. The molding on the back of the TV is con-caved at the location of the input jacks. Unfortunately the Fire Stick is too long to fit into that indentation. As such, I can't use it.I also have 2 Google ChromeCast adapters. They're great (just can't use Amazon Prime Video).
author: S. Thompson

review: I got this when it was offered 1/2 price for Prime members. Make any tv a smart tv with this stick. Menu is clean, navigation is quick, wireless connection is strong, lots of free apps, great simple remote and developer mode for other apps.I'm impressed how much horsepower and features this device has for its price and size. I would recommend this smart stick.
author: R. Gonzales

review: For the price this is an excellent device to make your TV samrt.
author: Jim VanDyke

review: Works pretty good....setup was easy...only negative is the standard remote...the circle control on top would better if replaced with buttons....remote is a little small for an adult male hand...print/captions on selection screens kinda small.... would buy again..
author: dave badger

review: It is great to have this Fire TV Stick to have access to watch Amazon Instant! I feel great not having to connect my laptop to the TV to always watch movies with the family!!!! Hassle free and easy set up! I am surprised to not have lost the remote for it being so small since I always misplace my iPhone 6 Plus!!!
author: Sophoeun
